original: @436b rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @436b rgya gar skad du /

original: a'arya dhva dza aa gra ke y'u ra n'a ma dh'a ra ni /
analyzed: a'arya dhva dza aa gra ke y'u ra n'a ma dh'a ra ni /

original: bod skad du; 'phags pa rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan zhes bya ba'i gzungs /
analyzed: bod skad du; 'phags pa rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan zhes bya ba'i gzungs /
translated: In Tibetan: Ārya-victory banner top ornament called dhāraṇī

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽'di skad bdag @437a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo // 'di skad bdag @437a *//
translated: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time,

original: bcom ldan 'das sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i nang na lva ba dkar po lta bu'i rdo leb la bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i nang na lva ba dkar po lta bu'i rdo leb la bzhugs te /
translated: the Blessed One was dwelling in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, on a flat rock like white wool.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin lha ma yin las pham /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin lha ma yin las pham /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, having been defeated and thoroughly defeated by the asuras,

original: rab tu pham nas de rtab cing rings pa'i gzugs kyis bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: rab tu pham nas de rtab cing rings pa'i gzugs kyis bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: with a hurried and quick form, went to where the Blessed One was. Having arrived, he bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet and said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: bdag 'di ltar lha ma yin dang g-yul bkye ba las; lha ma yin gyi dbang po thags bzang ris las pham /🔽rab tu pham ste /
analyzed: bdag 'di ltar lha ma yin dang g-yul bkye ba las; lha ma yin gyi dbang po thags bzang ris las pham / rab tu pham ste /
translated: and have been defeated and utterly destroyed by the asura lord Vemacitrin.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyang pham rab tu pham na /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyang pham rab tu pham na /
translated: If the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three have been defeated and utterly destroyed,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: bdag cag gis de la ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: bdag cag gis de la ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: lha'i dbang po /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po /

original: khyod kyis rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan zhes bya ba gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i gzungs zungs shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan zhes bya ba gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i gzungs zungs shig /
translated: you should uphold the dhāraṇī called the Armlet of the Victory Banner’s Peak, which cannot be conquered by others.

original: ngas kyang sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan las 'di mnos so //
analyzed: ngas kyang sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan las 'di mnos so //
translated: In the past, when I was a bodhisattva, I received this dhāraṇī from the thus-gone Victory Banner That Cannot Be Conquered.

original: mnos nas kyang gzhan la rgya cher yang dag par bshad do //
analyzed: mnos nas kyang gzhan la rgya cher yang dag par bshad do //
translated: After receiving it, I also explained it extensively to others.

original: mngon par dran te /🔽de tshun chad 'jigs pa'am /🔽bag tsha ba'am /
analyzed: mngon par dran te / de tshun chad 'jigs pa'am / bag tsha ba'am /
translated: I remember it well.🔽Since then, I have not experienced fear,🔽anxiety,

original: spu zing zhes @437b byed pa'am /
analyzed: spu zing zhes @437b byed pa'am /
translated: or the hairs on my body standing on end.

original: tha na skad cig yud tsam yang lus la gnod pa byung ma myong ngo //
analyzed: tha na skad cig yud tsam yang lus la gnod pa byung ma myong ngo //
translated: I have never experienced any harm to my body, not even for a moment.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan zhes bgyi ba gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i gzungs de gang lags /

translated: what is the dhāraṇī called the armor-like victory banner that cannot be overcome?🔽The Blessed One said:

analyzed: bdag 'jigs pa thams cad las srungs shig /
translated: Protect me from all fears!🔽Protect! Protect!

original: srungs shig / sarba ta th'a ga ta a'a ba lo ki te sv'ah'a /
analyzed: srungs shig / sarba ta th'a ga ta a'a ba lo ki te sv'ah'a /

original: gu na r'a dza pra bh'a sod ta me sv'ah'a /
analyzed: gu na r'a dza pra bh'a sod ta me sv'ah'a /

original: s'urya aarka ba mi le sv'ah'a; tsandra aarka bi ma le sv'ah'a /
analyzed: s'urya aarka ba mi le sv'ah'a; tsandra aarka bi ma le sv'ah'a /

original: sarba gra ha naksha tra dhe m'i ka ra ne sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sarba gra ha naksha tra dhe m'i ka ra ne sv'ah'a /

original: bdag 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa dang / nad 'go ba dang / 'khrug pa thams cad las @438b srungs shig /
analyzed: bdag 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa dang / nad 'go ba dang / 'khrug pa thams cad las @438b srungs shig /
translated: Protect me from all fears, dangers, epidemics, and disturbances!

original: srungs shig sv'ah'a /
analyzed: srungs shig sv'ah'a /

original: lha'i rgyal po /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po /

original: rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan zhes bya ba gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i gzungs 'dis khyod g-yul sprod pa'am /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan zhes bya ba gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i gzungs 'dis khyod g-yul sprod pa'am /
translated: The dhāraṇī called Armlet of the Victory Banner is invincible.

original: 'thab pa'am; rtsod pa'am /
analyzed: 'thab pa'am; rtsod pa'am /
translated: By means of this dhāraṇī called Armlet of the Victory Banner, you will be invincible in battle,🔽in disputes,

original: 'gyed pa'am / gang du 'gro yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'gyed pa'am / gang du 'gro yang rung ste /

original: mi 'jigs shing thams cad du rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs shing thams cad du rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: You will be fearless and victorious in all things.

original: rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'am mgul du btags na /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'am mgul du btags na /
translated: If it is tied to the top of a victory banner or around the neck,

original: mi'i rgyal po dang / skyes bu dpa' bo thams cad la srung bar byed do //
analyzed: mi'i rgyal po dang / skyes bu dpa' bo thams cad la srung bar byed do //
translated: it will protect all human kings and heroic men.

original: bud med kyi gzugs lta bur bsgyur nas mdun du 'dug ste mi 'jigs pa sbyin zhing srung bar byed do //
analyzed: bud med kyi gzugs lta bur bsgyur nas mdun du 'dug ste mi 'jigs pa sbyin zhing srung bar byed do //
translated: If it is transformed into the form of a woman and placed in front [of you], it will grant fearlessness and protect [you].

original: dpal skyed par byed /
analyzed: dpal skyed par byed /

original: pha rol gyi sde spa kong bar byed do //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sde spa kong bar byed do //
translated: It will terrify the armies of enemies.

original: bkra shis pa dang / gtsang ba dang / grags pa dang / dpal dang / phun sum tshogs pa kun tu gnas par byed do //
analyzed: bkra shis pa dang / gtsang ba dang / grags pa dang / dpal dang / phun sum tshogs pa kun tu gnas par byed do //
translated: It will bring about auspiciousness, purity, fame, glory, and the perfection of all things.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: The Blessed One, having spoken thus, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced and greatly praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: 'phags pa rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags pa rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
translated: The noble Dhāraṇī called The Armlet on the Tip of the Victory Banner is complete.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dza na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lotstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te skad gsar bcad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la bab pa /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dza na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lotstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te skad gsar bcad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la bab pa /
translated: Translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian preceptors Jñānamitra and Dānaśīla, and the chief editor and translator Bandé Yeshé Dé, after correcting and standardizing the terminology.
